ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: You will learn the basics of crystallography theory.
Good if you're going into crystallography. If not, reconsider.
I would recommend this course certainly. It is a good and useful course. Also fun to attend.
this is a class that must be taken if want to be more familiar with x-ray crystallography

Half-semester crash course in protein x-ray crystallography. It will require that you put in a lot of time on your own because the lectures are very confusing, but Yong's slides are great resources. Also, I'd definitely recommend getting the suggested books out of the library and reading through them for clear explanations of any topics that you think need clarification.
This course is detailed overview of how crystallography works. I would not recommend this to another student because I feel that it is difficult to learn anything from the class.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: It is very useful for my research. It totally clarified a lot of doubts.
it gives us more knowledge on x-ray crystallography
